title: ‘BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions’: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate - News18
summary:
BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate

Last Updated: December 17, 2024, 18:02 IST

Union Minister JP Nadda addressed the Rajya Sabha, emphasizing that the BJP has ended the policy of one nation, two constitutions in Jammu and Kashmir. He criticized the Congress party, referencing issues like the emergency and Article 370.

  • JP Nadda stated, “We ended the one nation-two constitutions policy in J&K.”
  • He highlighted that significant laws passed by Parliament were not previously applicable in J&K.
  • Nadda called attention to past political figures and their roles in India's integration.
  • He challenged the Congress party regarding their handling of the Constitution and other political issues.

“This was due to restrictions and limitations posed by Article 370 of the Constitution,” Nadda explained.

The debate in Parliament continues to reflect on the historical significance of the Constitution, with further discussions planned in the coming days.
newTitle: BJP Ended One Nation, Two Constitutions: JP Nadda On J&K During Rajya Sabha Debate

title: NASA James Webb Space Telescope reveals rocky planet formation in harsh environments - The Times of India
summary:
NASA's James Webb Space Telescope Reveals Rocky Planet Formation in Harsh Environments

Published on: December 16, 2023, Source: The Astrophysical Journal

The recent findings from NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope reveal that planets can form and survive in environments that are much harsher than previously believed. This challenges long-held theories about planet formation.

  • James Webb Telescope findings suggest long-lasting planet-forming disks exist around stars with low heavy elements.
  • Planet-forming disks can survive for tens of millions of years, providing ample time for planets to form.
  • Research challenges traditional models that argue planets cannot form in metal-poor environments.
  • Implications extend to understanding planet formation in the early universe, potentially dating back to shortly after the Big Bang.
“This implies that planets could have begun forming at a much earlier stage in the universe’s history than previously thought.” - Guido De Marchi

The discovery revolutionizes our understanding of planet formation and opens new avenues for research in astronomy, particularly regarding the early universe and the origins of our solar system.
newTitle: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope Sheds Light on Planet Formation in Harsh Environments

Three asteroids are on their way to Earth - India Today
summary:
Three Asteroids Approaching Earth Soon

Publication Date: November 2024   |   Source: India Today

On December 17, 2024, three asteroids will approach Earth, presenting unique scientific research opportunities. The asteroids include 2022 YO1, 2024 XR6, and 2024 XC17, all deemed non-threatening to the planet.

  • Asteroids 2022 YO1, 2024 XR6, and 2024 XC17 are set for close encounters with Earth.
  • 2022 YO1 will approach within 7,56,604 kilometers and measures 2.6–5.9 meters.
  • 2024 XR6, measuring 12–26 meters, will pass at about 15 million kilometers away.
  • 2024 XC17, measuring 9.1–20 meters, will come within 7.8 million kilometers.
  • All asteroids pose no threat to Earth and will provide research opportunities for astronomers.
Astronomers are tracking the asteroids with advanced systems to study their trajectories, sizes, and compositions, enhancing understanding of near-Earth dynamics.

The upcoming flybys of these asteroids present an excellent opportunity for scientific observation without endangering Earth.

Men Use Bat Poop To Grow Cannabis, Both Die Due To This Medical Condition - ABP Live
summary:
Men Use Bat Poop To Grow Cannabis, Both Die Due To This Medical Condition

Published at: 17 Dec 2024 01:33 PM (IST)

Source: Live Science

Two men in New York died from a rare fungal lung infection after using bat guano as fertilizer for their cannabis plants. They developed histoplasmosis, a dangerous condition caused by inhaling spores from bat droppings.

  • Both men were aged 59 and 64, with pre-existing health conditions.
  • They experienced symptoms such as fever, cough, significant weight loss, and respiratory failure.
  • Histoplasmosis is non-communicable between humans or pets.
  • The use of bat guano as fertilizer carries severe health risks.
  • 5-7% of hospitalized histoplasmosis patients may die from the infection.
“Their deaths should serve as a warning about the potential dangers of using bat guano as a fertilizer.”

This tragic incident highlights the need for awareness regarding unconventional agricultural practices and their unexpected health impacts.
newTitle: Men Die After Using Bat Guano to Fertilize Cannabis in New York

title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Jasprit Bumrah, Akash Deep's Fightback Ends Australia's Follow-On Plan At Stumps - NDTV Sports
summary:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test, Day 4 Highlights

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

The fourth day of the ongoing third Test between India and Australia showcased a remarkable performance by Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep, allowing India to avoid following on. At stumps, India scored 252/9, trailing by 193 runs.

  • India managed to avoid follow-on thanks to Bumrah and Deep's resilience.
  • KL Rahul scored 84 runs, while Ravindra Jadeja contributed 77 runs.
  • Pat Cummins took four wickets for Australia, with Mitchell Starc claiming three.
“AND THEY HAVE DONE IT!!!!! India have finally avoided the follow-on.”

The gripping contest on Day 4 ended with India poised to fight back further in the ongoing Test series, with their lower order showing impressive fight.

Magnesium Benefits: Why do we need more magnesium during winter? - The Times of India
summary:
Why Increased Magnesium Intake is Essential During Winter

Publication Date: Date Not Specified | Source: Source Not Specified

As winter arrives, our bodies face new challenges. The days grow shorter, temperatures drop, and our routines shift, impacting our health. Magnesium plays a crucial role in helping navigate the colder months.

  • Magnesium regulates mood and helps combat Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD).
  • It aids in handling stress by regulating the HPA axis and enhancing GABA's relaxing effects.
  • Magnesium supports immune function, helping to fend off winter illnesses.
  • It is critical for heart health and blood circulation during cold weather.
  • Magnesium improves sleep quality, countering disruptions from reduced daylight.
“Ensuring sufficient magnesium intake can help stabilize your mood and improve overall mental well-being during the darker months.”

Incorporating magnesium-rich foods or supplements during winter can support both physical and mental health.
newTitle: Why Increased Magnesium Intake is Essential During Winter

One nation, one election bills introduced in Lok Sabha, 269 MPs vote in favour - Hindustan Times
summary:
One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced in Lok Sabha

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Lok Sabha witnessed the introduction of bills aimed at holding simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and state assemblies, which garnered substantial support but faced sharp criticism from opposition parties.

  • Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal introduced two constitutional amendment bills for simultaneous elections.
  • A total of 269 MPs voted in favor of the bills while 198 opposed them.
  • The opposition, including Congress, Samajwadi Party, and Trinamool Congress, raised concerns about the constitutionality and potential threats to democratic processes.
  • Opposition MPs argued the bills undermine the Constitution's basic structure and are a step towards 'dictatorship.'
  • The bills propose amendments to hold mid-term elections only for the legislatures affected, delaying simultaneous elections until 2034.
“Introduction, consideration of one nation, one election bills beyond the legislative competence of this House, urge govt to withdraw it,” said Congress MP Manish Tewari.

The proposed changes have sparked widespread debate about their implications for democratic accountability and governance in India.
newTitle: One Nation, One Election Bills Introduced in Lok Sabha with Support from 269 MPs

title: Parliament session LIVE: Law minister tables bill for one nation, one election in Lok Sabha - Hindustan Times
Top Highest Grossing Indian Films Worldwide: Allu Arjun starrer Pushpa 2 overtakes RRR for Third - PINKVILLA
summary:
Pushpa 2 Surpasses RRR as the Third Highest-Grossing Indian Film Worldwide

Updated on: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Pinkvilla

Pushpa 2 has claimed the title of the third highest-grossing Indian film worldwide, surpassing RRR with a total gross of approximately Rs. 1259 crore.

  • Pushpa 2 generated Rs. 33 crore approximately on its 2nd Monday, bringing its worldwide box office total to Rs. 1259 crore.
  • The film's domestic gross is Rs. 1039.50 crore, while the overseas total is Rs. 219.50 crore.
  • Pushpa 2 is now the second highest-grossing film in India, yet remains outside the top fifteen in overseas grosses.
  • Despite its success, it is predicted that Pushpa 2 is unlikely to surpass the Rs. 1744 crore gross of Baahubali 2.
  • The current highest-grossing Indian films are: Dangal (1910.00 cr.), Baahubali: The Conclusion (1744.00 cr.), and Pushpa: The Rule (1259.00 cr.).
“Pushpa 2 is favourite to become the highest-grossing film in India, beating Baahubali 2.”

In conclusion, Pushpa 2’s record-setting performance reflects the film's strong appeal and the competitive landscape of Indian cinema.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Surpasses RRR as the Third Highest-Grossing Indian Film Worldwide

title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Listing Date: Check share listing price prediction on NSE, BSE - ET Now
summary:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Listing Date: Check share listing price prediction on NSE, BSE

Date: Updated Dec 17, 2024

Source: ET NOW

The Vishal Mega Mart IPO will see its shares listed on December 18, following a successful bidding process. The IPO garnered considerable interest, with solid subscription across categories.

  • The IPO price band is set between Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share, with a minimum lot size of 190 shares.
  • Overall subscription was 28.75 times, with retail subscribed 2.43 times, QIB 85.11 times, and NII 15.01 times.
  • The expected listing price is around Rs 98.50, reflecting a potential listing gain of approximately 26.28% based on current grey market premium.
  • Vishal Mega Mart experienced a 17.41% revenue growth in FY24, with a 43.78% rise in profit after tax.
  • The public offer is an offer for sale, meaning the company won't receive proceeds from the IPO.
"Disclaimer: The above article is meant for informational purposes only, and should not be considered as any investment advice."

Investors are encouraged to consult financial advisors before making investment decisions in light of the upcoming IPO listing.
newTitle: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Listing Date: Share Price Predictions and Details

Head of Russia’s nuclear defence forces killed in explosion in Moscow - The Hindu
summary:
Head of Russia’s Nuclear Defence Forces Killed in Moscow Explosion

Published on December 17, 2024, by The Hindu

The head of Russia’s Nuclear, Biological, and Chemical Defence Forces, Lt. General Igor Kirillov, was killed in an explosion in Moscow. The device was planted near a residential area, resulting in his death and that of his assistant.

  • Kirillov’s assistant also died in the explosion, which involved an explosive device hidden in a scooter.
  • Russian authorities have opened an investigation into the incident.
  • Kirillov had been sentenced in absentia by a Ukrainian court for his involvement in chemical weapons use during the conflict in Ukraine.
  • Ukraine’s Security Service reported over 4,800 uses of chemical weapons by Russian forces since February 2022.
“Investigators, forensic experts and operational services are working at the scene,” - Svetlana Petrenko, Investigative Committee spokesperson.

This tragic event marks a significant development in the ongoing conflict and raises serious questions about security measures surrounding military officials in Russia.
newTitle: Head of Russia’s Nuclear Defence Forces Killed in Moscow Explosion

Hazlewood likely to miss rest of India series with calf strain - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Josh Hazlewood Likely to Miss Remainder of India Series Due to Calf Strain

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Josh Hazlewood is expected to miss the rest of the Test series against India after suffering a calf strain during warm-ups in Brisbane. Scott Boland is likely to replace him for the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

  • Hazlewood experienced difficulties and had to leave the field after bowling one over.
  • Cricket Australia confirmed he sustained a right-sided calf strain.
  • Brendan Doggett and Sean Abbott are potential replacements for Hazlewood.
  • The Australian team is facing challenges due to rain delays and now has to rely on a limited bowling lineup.
  • Hazlewood had previously returned to the team after another injury and has missed significant play in recent seasons.
"It's not necessarily your typical side strain... It's caused me a lot of trouble over the last few years." - Josh Hazlewood

This injury raises concerns about Hazlewood's future in the series and his ongoing battle with injuries, impacting the Australian cricket team's dynamics.
newTitle: Josh Hazlewood Likely to Miss Remainder of India Series Due to Calf Strain

Day after Palestine bag, Priyanka Gandhi carries tote with ‘Bangladesh’ message to Parliament - Hindustan Times
summary:
Day after Palestine bag, Priyanka Gandhi carries tote with ‘Bangladesh’ message to Parliament

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Priyanka Gandhi has drawn attention once again by carrying a tote bag with messages highlighting the atrocities faced by minorities in Bangladesh, just a day after her earlier appearance with a bag supporting Palestine.

  • Priyanka and other Opposition MPs protested in Parliament with tote bags and placards advocating for minority rights in Bangladesh.
  • The attention on Priyanka Gandhi's Palestine bag raised discussions about the Indian government's stance on Bangladesh's minority issues.
  • She criticized the BJP for focusing on her choice of bag rather than addressing the pressing issues of minority rights.
  • Opposition members have been using symbolic gestures to draw attention to various political issues during the current Winter Session of Parliament.
Priyanka Gandhi stated, "The atrocities happening in Bangladesh, against minorities and Hindus...something should be done regarding this. Talks should be held with Bangladesh govt regarding this...and they should not say such useless things".

This latest appearance by Priyanka Gandhi reinforces the ongoing political discourse around minority rights in Bangladesh and the strategic use of symbolism in political protests.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Highlights Bangladesh Minorities' Plight with New Tote Bag at Parliament
